result.execSummary:
The defendant Javyn J. Freeman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence in being

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment and comply with any and all recommendations per probation
Submit to an Anger Management Assessment and follow through with ANY and ALL recommendations per probation

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): C.N.N.    DOB: 07/14/1997
*No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.
Defendant must submit an apology to victim(s) in a way and manner to be determined by probation

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javyn J. Freeman

defendant.name: Freeman, Javyn J.

records.addlTxt: Letters from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

9:02 AM ADA Fuhr calls case and states appearances. Defendant Javyn J. Freeman in court.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Javyn J. Freeman.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA Fuhr states an agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. Contingent upon the defendant's plea to Ct. 3 the State would move to dismiss and read in Ct's 1 and 2. So ordered. Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to Ct. 3 therefore Ct's 1 and 2 are DISMISSES and READ IN. ADA Fuhr states all Victim's Rights Legislations have been complied with. Court goes over the signed Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form, Line item by Line item with the defendant. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. Comments by parties.
Court Imposes:
Ct. 1- DRI
Ct. 2- DRI 
Ct. 3- Withheld Sentence- 2 Years Probation 
Conditions of Probation: (Consecutive to ANY other sentence in being) 
$300 Fine
$200 DNA + Sample
$100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge 
Submit to an AODA Assessment and an Anger Management Assessment then Follow through with ANY and ALL recommendations per probation 
Defendant shall have NO CONTACT with the victim
Defendant must submit an apology to victim(s) in a way and manner to be determined by probation 



Appeal Rights Given
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: 10:01 AM Defendant Javyn J. Freeman appeared, in custody via video means. Kelz, Karl J.  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   Notice of right to attorney given to DE.   Preliminary Hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.   If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.
State's demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): C.N.N., unless written consent is filed with the Clerk of Courts office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

(Clerk NFunk) 10:37 AM Defendant Javyn J. Freeman appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Javyn J. Freeman appeared by video means from PCJ. Case called, appearances and possible charges stated. DE's next Court date is 2/1/22 at 10:00 AM. Court gives DE notice of right to attorney. Court questions parties as to bond. DA states bond recommendation. Court orders $1000 cash bond and additional conditions of bond. Bond revocation, 21CF49. DE continues to ask when he will be released. Court explains the procedure for bail/bond hearings.
